intro: Crocodeilanthe bordoncillensis, commonly known as the Bordoncillensis fern, is a rare and unique species native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its intricate, lace-like fronds that are often adorned with small, spore-producing structures called sporangia. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires high levels of moisture and nutrient-rich soil to flourish. Its botanical significance lies in its role as an indicator species for undisturbed tropical ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to habitat loss and environmental degradation.
